page.title: 11AN INTERVIEW WITH MRS SPEAR
page.content: Mrs. Spear lives at Codden Farm which is situated on the north west slopes of Codden Hill. It is a dairy farm with about 160 milking cows and its own pasteurising dairy. The cows are milked twice daily at twelve hour intervals and the milk is pasteurised daily, bottled and delivered the next day. The area of distribution covers Bishop's Tawton, Newport, Venn and Whiddon Valley as well as some other parts of Barnstaple. The farm is run on an Autumn calving system which means that most calves are born during September. The winter feeding system is self-feed silage with concentrates fed by an out of parlour computer system. The cows are kept indoors all winter in larged covered yards and cubicles; this rests the ground for the grass to regrow.
